title: The Beloved's Praise
shortSummary: Song of Solomon Chapter 7 is a poetic celebration of the beloved's physical beauty and mutual love between the bride and bridegroom. The chapter uses vivid and symbolic imagery to express desire, affection, and the delight found in marital intimacy, highlighting the sanctity and joy of the marital relationship.
timeline: c. 10th century BC - United Monarchy period in Israel, traditionally attributed to Solomon

keyCharacters.name: The Beloved (Bride)
keyCharacters.description: The woman in the poem, praised for her beauty and desirability, representing the bride in the marriage relationship.

keyCharacters.name: The Beloved (Bridegroom)
keyCharacters.description: The man who expresses deep love and admiration for the bride, symbolizing the husband in the covenant of marriage.

definitions.definition: A plant mentioned for its fragrant smell and aphrodisiac qualities, symbolizing love and fertility.
A tree often symbolizing uprightness and beauty; here it is used metaphorically to describe the stature of the beloved.
A precious material derived from elephant tusks, used here to signify purity, strength, and beauty.
Balconies or terraces where the king is held, symbolizing honor and admiration.

outline.heading: The Bridegroom's Admiration of the Bride's Body
outline.description: The bridegroom describes the physical beauty of the bride in rich, poetic imagery, emphasizing her elegance, strength, and desirability as the work of a skillful Creator.

outline.heading: Expressions of Delight and Desire
outline.description: The bridegroom continues to praise the bride’s form and fragrance, expressing his deep pleasure and longing for her, highlighting the sweetness of marital love.

outline.heading: Mutual Belonging and Invitation
outline.description: The bride affirms her belonging to her beloved and invites him to share intimate fellowship, symbolizing the joy and exclusivity of the marital bond.

application: Celebrate and honor the beauty and gift of your spouse as a reflection of God's design for marriage.
Cultivate mutual affection and delight within marriage, recognizing it as a sacred and joyful union.
Express your love openly and invite your spouse into deeper fellowship and intimacy.
Recognize the marriage relationship as a picture of Christ’s love for the Church, marked by commitment and desire.

keyVerses.text: I am my beloved's, and his desire is toward me.
keyVerses.significance: This verse captures the mutual belonging and passionate commitment that defines the marital relationship.

keyVerses.text: How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!
keyVerses.significance: It expresses the joy and delight found in the beloved, highlighting the beauty of love within marriage.

keyVerses.text: The mandrakes give a smell, and at our gates are all manner of pleasant fruits, new and old, which I have laid up for thee, O my beloved.
keyVerses.significance: This verse symbolizes the richness and sweetness of love prepared and preserved for the beloved, emphasizing faithfulness and provision.
